instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> issues turning on from charger
threads.message:
This board had liquid damage in the 3v42 and battery circuit area when I received it. It was not turning on at all and no light on the charger either.
The I/o board is damn near spotless and the other side of the board looks to have no liquid damage anywhere including the smc and <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area.
I put flux on the damaged components and heated it up a little and then the fan spun and there was a light on the charger. I UC'd the board and I was able to install an OS on the SSD.

[I]The problem is that when I plug in the battery and then plug in the charger the machine turns on automatically. Afterwards if I shut down the machine and try plugging the charger in again it will not turn on automatically and I have to hit the power button.[/I]
When the battery is removed the machine turns on automatically every time the charger is plugged in.

When I go to the power information page I see the battery charges and runs off the battery fine and is in good condition.

The only components I have replaced are <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>. <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> looked burned and was measuring around 50 ohms so I replaced it along with <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> even though it measured fine.

Here are the areas I wrote down for having liquid damage before cleaning the board.
j6100
<CHIP>U7090</CHIP>
<RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> area
<CAPACITOR>C7117</CAPACITOR> area
<TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> area

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> issues turning on from charger
threads.message: I'm confused. Maybe I am missing something at midnight, but if this turns on when you hit the power button and not when just plugging in the charger this is normal condition. This works man, move onto next ticket!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> issues turning on from charger
threads.message:
Yea you are right. I don't know why but I thought that whenever you plug the charger in it should turn on automatically. 
This machine works fine then.  Thanks.
